annotation_sentence: Ah, hello. I have, um, problem with product I buy. Can I, uh, return it?
rationale: The sentence contains a greeting ('Ah, hello') and a request ('Can I, uh, return it?'), both of which are speech acts.
grammar_correctness: partially correct, but lacks articles and proper tense usage

annotation_sentence: Yes, it is not working. I think... ah, maybe it is broken when I open.
rationale: The sentence contains an assertion ('Yes, it is not working') and an expression of uncertainty ('I think... ah, maybe'), both of which are speech acts.
grammar_correctness: partially correct, but lacks proper tense usage

annotation_sentence: Um, how to say... I want, uh, same product but new one. Exchange, please.
rationale: The sentence contains a request for clarification ('Um, how to say...') and a request for exchange ('Exchange, please'), both of which are speech acts.
grammar_correctness: partially correct, but lacks articles and proper sentence structure

annotation_sentence: Thank you very much. I wait here, yes?
rationale: The sentence contains an expression of gratitude ('Thank you very much') and a request for confirmation ('I wait here, yes?'), both of which are speech acts.
grammar_correctness: partially correct, but lacks proper tense usage

annotation_sentence: Yes, okay. Let me see... Ah, yes, this one looks good.
rationale: The sentence contains an agreement ('Yes, okay') and an expression of approval ('Ah, yes, this one looks good'), both of which are speech acts.

annotation_sentence: Um, I think... no. That is all. Thank you for help.
rationale: The sentence contains an expression of uncertainty ('Um, I think... no') and an expression of gratitude ('Thank you for help'), both of which are speech acts.

annotation_sentence: Yes, I will. Thank you. Have nice day!
rationale: The sentence contains an agreement ('Yes, I will') and an expression of gratitude ('Thank you'), both of which are speech acts.
